TECHCOVERED

25 Websites to Read and Download Comics for Free, Legally

14 July 2013

Do you like reading comics? Of course you do. Everyone does! The important question here is, do you like reading (and downloading) comics, for free? Legally? If your answer is yes, then here is a exhaustive list of websites that allow you to download and read comics  online, legally.

  1. Comic Book Plus – Has a huge collection of free comic book, which consists of older public domain comics, which are nonetheless entertaining to read.

  2. Digital Comic Museum – A very huge list of older copyright free comics which can be downloaded for viewing offline or for your ebook reader.

  3. XKCD – Not exactly a comic book, but contains comic strips of sarcastic intentions.

  4. Garfield Strips – Who can not remember the original grumpy cat, Garfield? Find all comic strips from origin to today here.

  5. Comixology – Contains dozens of high quality entertaining comics, some of which are premium comics. However, registration is required.

  6. Comic Web – Contains a lot of older comics, all of which are downloadable. This website also has a list of olden times radio programs.

  7. Comic Domination – Has a dozen unpublished, entertaining comics that are frequently updated.

  8. Web Comics Nation – Has comics that are not so popular but yet fulfilling to read.

  9. Dilbert – Those who remember Dilbert from newspaper cartoons can read the entire archive here, for free.

  10. Cow Boy Comic – The story of a young cowboy and his adventures. Not a collection of comic books, but one single story. Can be read online.

  11. Goblin Comics – Is a story about Goblins. There are 5 books (still under production) with neat storylines.

  12. Archive’s Web Comic Universe – Is a huge archive of older comic books, which are easily downloadable into various formats and can also be read online. They are fun to read.

  13. Hundred Zeros Comic Books – These are a collection of comic books that are available for free download on Amazon. However, they can be read only on Kindle Reader.

  14. Marvel’s Free Comics – Marvel offers free comics that you can read and download. However, you need Marvel Reader to open these books.

  15. Collin’s Free comics list – Collin has prepared a very very long list of free comics. However only some of the links work now. The working ones are very interesting reads, though.

  16. Get Free Ebooks’ Comics – A collection of skilled author generated comics. They can be either downloaded or be read online.

  17. The Adventures of Ralph Snart – This is one book you cannot afford to miss out. This comic is a very high quality one, with interesting stories, containing issue from olden times to now, while also being updated daily.

  18. Top Web Comics – Contains free comics that are of good quality and can be read online.

  19. Runnin With a Gun – A Noir styled comic with a deep storyline. Updated daily. You can also subscribe to it through email to get it delivered to your inbox.

  20. The Oatmeal – short, sarcastic comics about present day scenarios. Entertaining to read, tough to continue at least without a chuckle. Not updated that frequently.

  21. Free Read Find – Searches amazon for free comics and then gives you a huge list. The comics can only be read by Kindle reader.

  22. Go Comics – Contains a huge list of comic strips from Calvin and Hobbs. to Dilbert, to peanuts, and many many more.

  23. Comic Genesis – Has more than thousands of comics which can be read online. The interface is not exactly award-winning, but the database is huge!

  24. Bookrix Comics – Has some noteworthy titles, which can be read online or be downloaded. Some links do not seem to work however.

  25. Daily Free Books – Has an updated list of free comics (and books) from Amazon. They can be downloaded from Amazon, but can only be viewed in a kindle reader.

Hope you found this list helpful. If you have any suggestions, or if you find any of these links not working, do reach out and comment.
